docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New- York Times: I observe that the Judges of the Supreme Court have made an application to the Board of Supervisors for an increase of salaries, and I trust they may not be treated with the supreme indifference shown to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New- York Times: I observe that the Judges of the Supreme Court have made an application to the Board of Supervisors for an increase of salaries, and I trust they may not be treated with the supreme indifference shown to the suplication of the Superior Court Judges for a little more light, a little more air-elements generally supposed to be essential to the well-being of all classes,

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--The Commissioners of Health met yesterday hood is the Mayor's office, the Board being present, with Dr MUNDY, Health Officer of Castleton, Staten Island. The buk ??, from Ro Janeri, was ordered to be detained below five days...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--The Commissioners of Health met yesterday hood is the Mayor's office, the Board being present, with Dr MUNDY, Health Officer of Castleton, Staten Island. The buk ??, from Ro Janeri, was ordered to be detained below five days and ?? gone up under the direction of the Health officer.

docs.snippet: We published on Friday a very extraordinary report from the pen o Mr. HLLIDAY, concerning our City's deficiency of dwelling houses. In 1856 nineteen Wards of New-York had a population of 535,027 souls, and only 36,088 houses to shelter them in, or an...
docs.lead_paragraph: We published on Friday a very extraordinary report from the pen o Mr. HLLIDAY, concerning our City's deficiency of dwelling houses. In 1856 nineteen Wards of New-York had a population of 535,027 souls, and only 36,088 houses to shelter them in, or an average of 15 persons under each roof.

headline.main: THE WAR IN EUROPE.; General Movement of the War. Cotton Bull---Breadstuff's Steady---Provisions Quiet---Consols 91 3-1 a 92. FRANCIS II. SUCCEEDS TO THE CROWN, GARIBALDI ABOUT ENTERING LOMBARDY. Correspondence and Details by the America. DEATH OF THE KING OF NAPLES The First Battles of the Campaign. Success of the Sardinian Army on the Sesia. NEWS BY THE CITY OF WASHINGTON The Austrians Beaten by the Allies at Montebello. TWO HUNDRED AUSTRIANS PRISONERS, Two Thousand of the Former Killed, and Seven Hundred of the Latter,

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw steamship City of Washington, from Liverpool on Wednesday, 25th of May, via Queenstown 26th, passed Cape Race at 9 o'clock on Thursday evening, in route to New York. The news was obtained by the news yacht of the Associated Press, but could not be forwarded until Saturday, owing to the non-working of the wires. It In of the highest importance.

docs.lead_paragraph: The war in Italy has at last assumed an active character. docs.lead_paragraph: HAMILTON COLLEGE.--The commencement honors at Hamilton College have just been announced as follows: Valedictorian, Horace R. Peck, Hudson, N. Y. Astronomical Oration, Alvin Baker, Lafayette. Philosophical Oration, Isaac H. Hall, Auburn. Legal Oration, Chas. A. Hawley, Augusta. Rhetorical Oration, Harlan P. Lloyd, Angelica, Classical Oration,

docs.snippet: HEALTH COMMISSIONERS.--The Health Commissioners met yesterday at the usual time and place' Mayor TIEMANN President, CORNELL, Drs. GREEN ROCKWELL MILLER and BOYD being present. The brigs Breeze and Reindeer, both from Rio Janeiro, the former in 42 and...
docs.lead_paragraph: HEALTH COMMISSIONERS.--The Health Commissioners met yesterday at the usual time and place' Mayor TIEMANN President, CORNELL, Drs. GREEN ROCKWELL MILLER and BOYD being present. The brigs Breeze and Reindeer, both from Rio Janeiro, the former in 42 and the latter in 4 days, reported that the health of that port was improving.

docs.snippet: A telegram from St. Louis, published yesterday, announced the renoltion of a verdict of $100,000 against one HENRY SHAW, of that city, at the suit of MISS EFFIE CARZTANG, in an action of breach of promise of marriage. The St. Louis papers publish...

headline.main: Breach of Promise Case in St. Louis--Damages $100,000.

docs.lead_paragraph: A telegram from St. Louis, published yesterday, announced the renoltion of a verdict of $100,000 against one HENRY SHAW, of that city, at the suit of MISS EFFIE CARZTANG, in an action of breach of promise of marriage. The St. Louis papers publish voluminous reports of the evidence. It appears that the detendant, HENEY SHAW, is sixty years of age, and very wealthy.

headline.main: FROM CALIFORNIA.; Close of the Mohave War--Results of the Expedition--The Overland Mail Service--Colonge of Sliver Dollars at the San Francisco Mint--Shipping. Arrival of the Overland Mail.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Uncle Sant, of the Opposition Line, did not arrive here until Saturday last, bringing the passengers who left New. York in the Northern Light on the 11th ult. Notwithstanding their long and disagreeable voyage, in second-rate ships, most of the passengers arrived in protty good health. Mr. JOHN DARLI?, of Linn County, Oregon, died at sea on the 16th ult., of apoplexy. lie was accompanied by his son.
